name: My SWE Portfolio
title: Portfolio
description: My portfolio website showcasing my skills, progress and career as a software engineer.
caseStudy: Its always a good idea to have a portfolio to showcase your work and projects to friends, future employers, other prospects and especially to yourself as a good reminder of the humble beginnings as you look back. The portfolio uses a static site generator (gatsby) and uses the (typescript) version for the benefit and correctness of typed languages.The visual design was inspired by material and the use of rounded and casual icons to fit the them, along with a clean yet vibrant and simple fusion was a successful blend and quite enticing.
experience: After a long time trying to shy away from React and being unsure of what to think about it. i finally jumped into it to check it out. Friends would cheer and recommend to try it out but as a backend lover i didn't think of venturing into it. until the thought of jobs requiring it as a part of fullstack developers and engineers, and it along with angular being the pioneers of old, it then was a matter of time to chose between the two. i then read a book from syncfusion.com called, 'React Succinctly' and from there it was a fun ride.Then gatsby was out of curiosity about static site generators along with the adoption of typescript and trying it out live on a working project so i can truly appreciate and see its pros and cons.

name: Accommo-Venient
title: Accommo-Venient
description: An old, school group projects. Its for college students, off-campus accommodation.
caseStudy: Arguably one of my most painful project (growth pains) and best project in terms of experience, wow    and appreciation of development. This is where the love for php, web development, design, css and dynamic pages (using ajax) came from. We couldn't complete when it was time for submission due to scope creep and the sheer excitement of what we could do and how awesome it was, all the things we could do, all the functions we could add to make it cool. For me personally it was like discovering a new toy that could do all kinds of amazing stuff you had not given thought to
experience: Fast forward to 2023 and out of nostalgia this project is still on my mind and ive decided to         upload it and add it to the list of projects on my portfolio, showcasing where i came from and also a good feel and boost of self confidence. i am proud of this group project
